intro: Tetramolopium arbusculum, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its woolly, gray-green foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to arid environments. Its root system is deep and drought-resistant, allowing it to survive in sandy or rocky soils. Tetramolopium arbusculum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
